intro: Tricholepidium mutense, commonly known as the variable spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, often found in meadows and disturbed soils. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia. It produces a milky latex when the stems or leaves are damaged, a common trait among members of its family. Tricholepidium mutense is typically herbaceous, with a short lifespan and a tendency to spread through seed dispersal.
